meanings.definition: The presence of two or more chronic conditions in a patient.
meanings.sent1: The doctor discussed the comorbidity of diabetes and hypertension in the patient.
meanings.sent2: The comorbidity of asthma and allergies is common in children.
meanings.sent3: The comorbidity of a sweet tooth and cavities can be quite ironic.
meanings.sent4: The comorbidity of stress and insomnia is like a never-ending cycle.
meanings.sent5: The comorbidity of arthritis and osteoporosis makes movement difficult for the elderly.

meanings.definition: The simultaneous presence of two or more diseases or medical conditions.
meanings.sent1: Researchers are studying the comorbidity of heart disease and obesity.
meanings.sent2: The comorbidity of depression and anxiety often requires specialized treatment.
meanings.sent3: The comorbidity of a cold and a broken leg would be quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: The comorbidity of traffic and road rage is a dangerous combination.
meanings.sent5: The comorbidity of allergies and asthma can be life-threatening if not managed properly.
